DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Manipulation Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the cord blood unit manipulation method.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal. [Manually curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Property.preferredDefinition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Phototherapy that combines the use of psoralen with UVA light as a treatment for various skin conditions.

Concepts.definition: Phototherapy that combines the use of psoralen with UVA light as a treatment for various skin conditions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Red blood cells. Mature erythrocytes are non-nucleated, biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.

Concepts.definition: A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.
Made less in size or amount or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: The act of preparing or putting through a prescribed procedure.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The act of preparing or putting through a prescribed procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment to destroy T cells, which play an important role in the immune response. Elimination of T cells from a bone marrow graft from a donor may reduce the chance of an immune reaction against the recipient's tissues.

Concepts.definition: Treatment to destroy T cells, which play an important role in the immune response. Elimination of T cells from a bone marrow graft or peripheral blood stem cell graft from a donor may reduce the chance of an immune reaction against the recipient's tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
Made less in size or amount or degree.

PermissibleValues.value: Plasma and red blood cell reduction

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Red blood cells. Mature erythrocytes are non-nucleated, biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.
Made less in size or amount or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The amount of something per unit size.: Independent; not united or joint.

Concepts.definition: The amount of something per unit size.
Independent; not united or joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Possessing a single nucleus.: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

Concepts.definition: Possessing a single nucleus.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The act of preparing or putting through a prescribed procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.: Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Large, phagocytic mononuclear leukocytes produced in the vertebrate bone marrow and released into the blood; contain a large, oval or somewhat indented nucleus surrounded by voluminous cytoplasm and numerous organelles.: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

Concepts.definition: Large, phagocytic mononuclear leukocytes produced in the vertebrate bone marrow and released into the blood; contain a large, oval or somewhat indented nucleus surrounded by voluminous cytoplasm and numerous organelles.
To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prominin-1 (865 aa, ~97 kDa) is encoded by the human PROM1 gene. This protein may play a role in hematopoiesis, but an exact function has yet to be elucidated. The protein has been implicated in tumor pathogenesis and formation in several cancers, including retinoblastoma, hemangioma, and glioblastoma phenotypes. Additionally, the protein has been used as a marker to distinguish cells that have the potential to become cancerous from the larger normal cell population.: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

Concepts.definition: Prominin-1 (865 aa, ~97 kDa) is encoded by the human PROM1 gene. This protein may play a role in hematopoiesis, but an exact function has yet to be elucidated. The protein has been implicated in tumor pathogenesis and formation in several cancers, including retinoblastoma, hemangioma, and glioblastoma phenotypes. Additionally, the protein has been used as a marker to distinguish cells that have the potential to become cancerous from the larger normal cell population.
To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A protein found on the surface of some bone marrow and blood cells.: The separation of specific cells or cell populations from a heterogeneous mixture. Specifically it refers to the selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing the specified characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34 (385 aa, ~41 kDa) is encoded by the human CD34 gene. This protein plays a role in cell-cell adhesion and may have a role in leukocyte migration.
The selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing specific characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited.: Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.: Increase; a process of becoming larger or more numerous or more important.

Concepts.definition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.
A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
Made less in size or amount or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: suppressor T-lymphocyte marker that functions as a receptor for MHC class I antigen.: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.

Concepts.longName: T-Cell Surface Glycoprotein CD8 Beta Chain
Concepts.definition: T-cell surface glycoprotein CD8 beta chain (210 aa, ~24 kDa) is encoded by the human CD8B gene. This protein plays a role in T-cell cytotoxicity.
Made less in size or amount or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lymphoid cells concerned with humoral immunity. They are short-lived cells resembling bursa-derived lymphocytes of birds in their production of immunoglobulin upon appropriate stimulation.: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.

Concepts.definition: Immunologically important lymphocyte that is not thymus-dependent, is either short-lived and naive or long-lived and of memory phenotype, and resembles the bursa-derived lymphocyte of birds in that it is responsible for the production of immunoglobulins.
Made less in size or amount or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To reduce in strength or concentration, especially by the addition of water.

Concepts.definition: To reduce in strength or concentration, especially by the addition of water.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process of applying a solvent (e.g., water) or a solution (e.g., SSC/SDS) to a biomaterial or an array to remove impurities or unwanted compounds.

Concepts.definition: The process of applying a solvent (e.g., water) or a solution (e.g., SSC/SDS) to a biomaterial or an array to remove impurities or unwanted compounds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process using centrifugation of whole blood to obtain a white blood cell layer highly enriched for neutrophils, lymphocytes, monocytes and progenitor cells.

Concepts.definition: A process using centrifugation of whole blood to obtain a white blood cell layer highly enriched for neutrophils, lymphocytes, monocytes and progenitor cells.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The mode or manner or orderly sequence of events of a process or procedure.

Concepts.definition: Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
